CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In the out - of - plane of PQCDTB , as shown Figure 1a , a sharp diffraction peak was observed at 4.0 , 8.1 , 12.2 ° , which indicates the formation of ordered lamellar structure as an out - of - plane peak ( h00 ) by the alkyl side chain of quinacridone and conventional edge-on πstacking. 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ). In the ( 010 ) in-plane pattern related to π-π stacking , as shown Figure 1b , a broad diffraction peak was detected at approximately 24.0 ° . Using the same calculation , the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 3.7 Å. The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. The structure has an impact on π-π stacking ( d π ) as well. 27 By calculating PCZDTB and PQCDTB using a density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation , the tilt angle has been comparatively analyzed. In terms of tilt angle , PCZDTB was 27-28 ° , while PQCDTB was 19-21 ° . Compared with PCZDTB , formation of a planar backbone and stronger π-π stacking were observed in PQCDTB ( see Supporting Information ). On the basis of this result , it has been confirmed that π-π stacking was more effective in PQCDTB than in PCZDTB because of coplanarity of the quinacridone unit that was introduced to the main chain of PQCDTB. 13 Figure 2 showed the UV - visible spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB. As shown in Figure 2 , the maximum absorption peak of PQCDTB ( λ max ) was observed at 389 and 539 nm , respectively , in solution ( 10^-6 M in chloroform ). On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. The band around 380 nm in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB can be assigned to π-π* transition whereas the 530-550 band are due to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between donor and acceptor moieties. 10 The absorption spectrum of PQCDTB is broadened and red - shifted compared to that of PCZDTB. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. quinacridone alkyl side chain
2. lamellar structure (ordered lamellar structure)
3. thiophene
4. thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers
5. PCZDTB
6. fluorene-thiophene
7. benzene-thiophene linkage
8. thiophenethiophene linkage
9. PQCDTB
10. chloroform
11. π-π* transition
12. intramolecular charge transfer (ICT)

| Material Name |
| --- |
| quinacridone alkyl side chain |
| lamellar structure (ordered lamellar structure) |
| thiophene |
| thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers |
| PCZDTB |
| fluorene-thiophene |
| benzene-thiophene linkage |
| thiophenethiophene linkage |
| PQCDTB |
| chloroform |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| quinacridone alkyl side chain |
| thiophene |
| thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers |
| PCZDTB |
| fluorene-thiophene |
| PQCDTB |

The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to materials, but rather describe properties or measurements related to the materials.

2. π-π stacking distance (dπ)
3. tilt angle (for PCZDTB and PQCDTB)
4. maximum absorption peak wavelength in solution (λ max) for PQCDTB and PCZDTB
5. band assigned to π-π* transition
6. band due to intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between donor and acceptor moieties.

Paragraph: In the out - of - plane of PQCDTB , as shown Figure 1a , a sharp diffraction peak was observed at 4.0 , 8.1 , 12.2 ° , which indicates the formation of ordered lamellar structure as an out - of - plane peak ( h00 ) by the alkyl side chain of quinacridone and conventional edge-on πstacking. 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ). The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. The structure has an impact on π-π stacking ( d π ) as well. 27 By calculating PCZDTB and PQCDTB using a density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation , the tilt angle has been comparatively analyzed. In terms of tilt angle , PCZDTB was 27-28 ° , while PQCDTB was 19-21 ° . Compared with PCZDTB , formation of a planar backbone and stronger π-π stacking were observed in PQCDTB ( see Supporting Information ). On the basis of this result , it has been confirmed that π-π stacking was more effective in PQCDTB than in PCZDTB because of coplanarity of the quinacridone unit that was introduced to the main chain of PQCDTB. 13 Figure 2 showed the UV - visible spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB. On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. The band around 380 nm in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB can be assigned to π-π* transition whereas the 530-550 band are due to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between donor and acceptor moieties. 10 The absorption spectrum of PQCDTB is broadened and red - shifted compared to that of PCZDTB. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Lamellar d-spacing (d1) for PQCDTB: 21.8 Å (λ = 2d[sin θ])
2. π-π stacking distance (dπ) for PQCDTB: 3.7 Å
3. π-π stacking distance (dπ) for thiophene and thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers: 4.0-4.4 Å
4. π-π stacking distance (dπ) for PCZDTB: 4.3 Å
5. Tilt angle for PCZDTB: 27-28°
6. Tilt angle for PQCDTB: 19-21°
7. Maximum absorption peak (λ max) for PQCDTB (in solution): 389 nm (for the π-π* transition) and 539 nm (for intramolecular charge transfer)
8. Maximum absorption peak (λ max) for PCZDTB (in solution): 386 nm (for the π-π* transition) and 514 nm (for intramolecular charge transfer)
